intro: Ruellia nubica, commonly known as the cloud mountain ruellia, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central America. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect growth habit and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of blue or purple flowers that bloom throughout the growing season. Ruellia nubica thrives in well-drained soil and partial to full sunlight, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens or containers. Its ornamental value and adaptability make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant plants.
